<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Wolf Stance](/Feats.aspx?ID=5984) <actions string="Single Action" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Monk" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=656" />
<trait label="Stance" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=701" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 119 <sup>1.1</sup>

**Archetypes** [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=67) (Level 4), [Wild Mimic](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=226) (Level 4), [Martial Artist](/Archetypes.aspx?ID=255) (Level 4)

**Requirements**
You are unarmored.

</column>

---

You enter the stance of a wolf, low to the ground with your hands held like fangs. You can make wolf jaw unarmed attacks. These deal 1d8 piercing damage; are in the [brawling](/WeaponGroups.aspx?ID=4) group; and have the [agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=526), [backstabber](/Traits.aspx?ID=544), [finesse](/Traits.aspx?ID=602), [nonlethal](/Traits.aspx?ID=661), and [unarmed](/Traits.aspx?ID=719) traits.

 If you're flanking a target while in Wolf Stance, your wolf jaw unarmed attacks also gain the [trip](/Traits.aspx?ID=716) trait.

<title level="2">Wolf Stance leads to...</title>
[Wolf Drag](/Feats.aspx?ID=6009)
name: Wolf Stance
